title: Greenwald: Media's Russia Coverage Damaged Itself More than Trump
content:
Exactly. There is a difference between objective reporting
and subjective opinion. If people read or watch an opinion piece,
they know they are seeing a point of view.
The corporate mass media, however, used to claim objectivity, except in its defined "editorials."
There is a place for both, but today's mass media mislabels
its leftist activism as objective reporting. They slant what
they advertise as objective both in how the information is presented, and in what they do or do not choose to allow their
audience to discover.
And they hope no one notices.
People do notice, and the mass media will never regain the
credibility it has lost. People hate to be lied to, either through commission or omission.
People demand all the facts and differing points of view, to
then be able to think and decide for themselves. That is why
they flock to new media sites like Breitbart.
